intro: Villadia necaxana, commonly known as the Mexican rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Villadia necaxana is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
